page.title: 10THE OLD RAILWAY LINE
page.content: This runs through the parish in a northerly direction. It is used by people for walking and children as a play area. It acts as a nature reserve throughout the year supporting a variety of flora and fauna. In 1985 it was found that there were 23 species of wild flower, 3 species of grass, 3 of trees, a variety of birds nesting and animals living on the line. The water drain at the side of the line supports a number of fish and newts. {The ecology}covers a wide range of natural things man has used in his daily life, which are now not used, although we still collect elderberries and blackberries to make jam, wine and use as fruit. This area is soon to become the A16 by-pass and its ecology will change.
